metadata.Title: CVE-2011-1187 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 10.0.648.127 allows remote attackers to bypass theSame Origin Policy via unspecified vectors, related to an "error messageleak."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-1187` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

firefox - 12.0+build1-0ubuntu0.12.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 12.0+build1-0ubuntu0.12.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 12.0+build1-0ubuntu0.12.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 12.0+build1-0ubuntu0.12.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-testsuite - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.0.648.127~r76697-0ubuntu1').
firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '12.0+build1-0ubuntu0.12.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.0~b4+build1-0ubuntu1').
